message: I'm going to call this season (2011) Little Red Riding Hood.  First it was too hot, now it is too cold...we need it to be "just right". Sap is now frozen in the bags.
We've got 180 gallons of sap in the barrels and more dripping.  Will start boiling Wed afternoon...time TBD.
Ounce for ounce maple syrup has as much calcium as milk and it's loaded with minerals.
Anne and David collected 140 gallons of Sap Friday. As it didn't get below freezing last night the trees have slowed their drip.  We may try to boil Saturday afternoon.
"Pour on the syrup; it's good for you!" http://news.discovery.com/human/maple-syrup-antioxidant-110402.html#mkcpgn=rssnws1
